docs.title: Description
docs.text: This API is used to get the exchange rate of the BCV (Central Bank of Venezuela). This API is a simple REST API that returns the exchange rate of the BCV in JSON format.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Ready to start using the BCV API? Check out our Quick Start guide to get up and running in minutes.

For detailed installation instructions, see the Installation Guide.

For comprehensive API documentation, visit the API Reference or the interactive Swagger UI.

docs.title: Get Latest Rate
docs.text:
• GET /rates/ - Get the latest exchange rate for USD
  • Response: {"dollar": 36.5, "date": "2025-08-20"}

docs.title: Get Rate by Date
docs.text:
• GET /rates/{date} - Get the exchange rate for a specific date
  • Parameters:
  • date (path): Date in YYYY-MM-DD format
  • Response: {"dollar": 36.5, "date": "2025-08-20"}

docs.title: Get Rate History
docs.text:
• GET /rates/history - Get exchange rate history within a date range
  • Parameters:
  • start_date (query, optional): Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
  • end_date (query, optional): End date in YYYY-MM-DD format
  • Default behavior: If no dates provided, returns last 30 days
  • Example: /rates/history?start_date=2025-02-15&end_date=2025-03-15
  • Response: 
{
  "start_date": "2025-02-15",
  "end_date": "2025-03-15", 
  "rates": [
    {"dollar": 36.5, "date": "2025-03-15"},
    {"dollar": 36.4, "date": "2025-03-14"}
  ]
}

docs.title: Create New Rate (Authenticated)
docs.text:
• POST /rates/ - Create a new rate using the BCV API
  • Authentication: Bearer token required
  • Response: {"dollar": 36.5, "date": "2025-08-20", "id": 1}

docs.title: Login
docs.text:
• POST /users/token - Get access token
  • Parameters: username/password form data
  • Response: {"access_token": "...", "token_type": "bearer"}

docs.title: Local Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository and create a .env file in the root of the project, use .env.example as a template Remember to replace the values of the variables with your own values.
git clone https://github.com/rafnixg/bcv-api.git
cd bcv-api
cp .env.example .env
  1. Create a virtual environment
python -m venv venv
  1. Activate the virtual environment
# Windows
venv\Scripts\activate
# Linux
source venv/bin/activate
  1. Install the dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
  1. Run the API
uvicorn bcv_api.main:app --reload
  1. Open your browser and go to http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Using Docker
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository and create a .env file in the root of the project, use .env.example as a template Remember to replace the values of the variables with your own values.
git clone https://github.com/rafnixg/bcv-api.git
cd bcv-api
cp .env.example .env
  1. Build the image with the Dockerfile, select the Dockerfile.newrelic file if you want to monitor the application with NewRelic
# Without newrelic monitoring
docker build -t bcv-api .

# With newrelic monitoring
docker build -t bcv-api -f Dockerfile.newrelic .
  1. Run the container
docker run -d --name bcv-api -p 8000:8000 --env-file .env bcv-api:latest
  1. Open your browser and go to http://localhost:8000
